marketRoleDescriptions.BalanceResponsibleParty: Responsible for its imbalances, meaning the difference between the energy volume physically injected to or withdrawn from the system and the final nominated energy volume, including any imbalance adjustment within a given imbalance settlement period.
marketRoleDescriptions.BillingAgent: Responsible for invoicing a concerned party.
marketRoleDescriptions.EnergySupplier: Supplies electricity to or takes electricity from a Party Connected to the Grid at an Accounting Point. Additional information: An Accounting Point can only have one Energy Supplier. When additional suppliers are needed the Energy Supplier delivers/takes the difference between established (e.g. measured or calculated) production/consumption and the (accumulated) contracts with other suppliers
marketRoleDescriptions.GridAccessProvider: Responsible for providing access to the grid through an Accounting Point for energy consumption or production by the Party Connected to the Grid. The Grid Access Provider is also responsible for creating and terminating Accounting Points.
marketRoleDescriptions.ImbalanceSettlementResponsible: Responsible for settlement of the difference between the contracted quantities with physical delivery and the established quantities of energy products for the Balance Responsible Parties in a Scheduling Area. Note: The Imbalance Settlement Responsible may delegate the invoicing responsibility to a more generic role such as a Billing Agent.
marketRoleDescriptions.MeteredDataAdministrator: Responsible for storing and distributing validated measured data.
marketRoleDescriptions.MeteredDataResponsible: Responsible for the establishment and validation of measured data based on the collected data received from the Metered Data Collector. The party is responsible for the history of metered data for a Metering Point.
marketRoleDescriptions.MeteringPointAdministrator: Responsible for administrating and making available the Metering Point characteristics, including registering the parties linked to the Metering Point.
marketRoleDescriptions.MeterOperator: Used for delegation of messages in and out of DataHub

message.label: This will issue new data to the actors

body.BALANCE_FIXING: Rerunning a balance fixing will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.
body.WHOLESALE_FIXING: Rerunning a wholesale fixing will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.
body.FIRST_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: Rerunning a 1. correction settlement will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.
body.SECOND_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: Rerunning a 2. correction settlement will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.
body.THIRD_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: Rerunning a 3. correction settlement will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.
body.CAPACITY_SETTLEMENT: Rerunning a capacity settlement will result in all associated actors receiving new data for their settlements.

body.BALANCE_FIXING: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous balance fixings and new data will be issued to the actors.
body.WHOLESALE_FIXING: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous wholesale fixings and new data will be issued to the actors.
body.FIRST_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous 1. correction settlements and new data will be issued to the actors.
body.SECOND_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous 2. correction settlements and new data will be issued to the actors.
body.THIRD_CORRECTION_SETTLEMENT: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous 3. correction settlements and new data will be issued to the actors.
body.CAPACITY_SETTLEMENT: You are about to issue new data for already settled periods. This will invalidate previous capacity settlements and new data will be issued to the actors.
